text: Nahum
Superscription
The oracle concerning Nineveh—
the scroll of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite:
Half-Acrostic: Yahweh Takes Vengeance against His Enemies
Yahweh is a jealous God and avenging;
Yahweh is avenging and ⸤full of wrath⸥.\f + \fr 1:2 \ft Literally “a lord of wrath” \f*
Yahweh takes vengeance against his enemies;
he rages against his adversaries.
Yahweh is slow to anger but great \add in\add* power;
he will certainly not allow \add the guilty\add* to go unpunished.
⸤He marches⸥\f + \fr 1:3 \ft Literally “His path” \f* in storm wind and in gale;
storm clouds \add are the\add* dust of his feet.
He rebukes the sea and he dries up the rivers;
he makes all the rivers run dry.
Bashan and Carmel wither;\f + \fr 1:4 \ft MT reads “languishes,” but the versions reflect “withers,” which also restores the acrostic \f*
the blossom of Lebanon languishes.
Mountains quake before him;
the hills shake apart.\f + \fr 1:5 \ft Or “melt” \f*
The earth heaves before him—
the world and all her inhabitants.
His indignation—who can stand before it?
Who can endure ⸤his fierce anger⸥?\f + \fr 1:6 \ft Literally “the heat of his anger” \f*
His wrath is poured out like fire;
rocks are shattered before\f + \fr 1:6 \ft Or “by” \f* him.
Yahweh is good—a refuge in \add the\add* day of distress;
\add he knows\add* those who take refuge in him.
But with a rushing torrent he will bring \add Nineveh\add* to an end;
he will chase his enemies into darkness.
Yahweh Will Destroy Nineveh
What\f + \fr 1:9 \ft Or “Why …?” \f* do you plot against Yahweh?
⸤He will completely destroy it⸥;\f + \fr 1:9 \ft Literally “he will make a complete destruction” \f*
trouble will not rise up a second time!
For like entangled thorns,
and like their drink which is drunk,
they will be consumed like fully dry chaff.
From you goes out one who plots evil against Yahweh,
one who plans wickedness.
Yahweh Will Deliver Judah and Destroy Nineveh
Yahweh says this:
“Even though \add they are\add* powerful and likewise many,
even so they will be cut off and pass away.
Though I have afflicted you,\f + \fr 1:12 \ft That is, Judah \f*
I will afflict you\f + \fr 1:12 \ft That is, Judah \f* no longer.
And now, I will break his yoke from upon you;
I will snap your bonds.”
Yahweh has commanded concerning you:
“Your name will no longer be sown.
I will cut off ⸤the idols and images⸥\f + \fr 1:14 \ft Literally “the idols and the molten idols” \f* from the ⸤temple⸥\f + \fr 1:14 \ft Literally “house” \f* of your gods;
⸤I will send you to the grave⸥\f + \fr 1:14 \ft Literally “I will make your grave” \f* because you are worthless.”
\f + \fr 1:15 \ft \xt Nahum 1:15–2:13 \ft in the English Bible is 2:1–14 in the Hebrew Bible \f* Look! On the mountains!
The feet of the one who brings good tidings,
the one who proclaims peace!
“Celebrate \add a festival\add*, O Judah,
Fulfill your vows!
For he will not invade you again;
the wicked one is cut off completely!”
